subdisciplines.name: Bioarchaeology
subdisciplines.description: The study of biological remains, including bones, teeth, and DNA, to understand ancient human and animal populations.

subdisciplines.name: Anthropological Archaeology
subdisciplines.description: The study of human society and culture through material remains.

subdisciplines.name: Landscape Archaeology
subdisciplines.description: The study of the ways in which people have changed and interacted with the landscape.

subdisciplines.name: Historical Archaeology
subdisciplines.description: The study of material culture from the recent past, often focusing on the colonial period.

subdisciplines.name: Classical Archaeology
subdisciplines.description: The study of ancient Greece and Rome through their material culture

subdisciplines.name: Egyptology
subdisciplines.description: The study of ancient Egypt through its archaeology, history, and culture

subdisciplines.name: Maritime Archaeology
subdisciplines.description: The study of human interactions with the sea through the excavation and analysis of shipwrecks, harbors, and other underwater sites

subdisciplines.name: Paleoanthropology
subdisciplines.description: The study of the biological and cultural evolution of early humans and their relatives.
